Tasks.Task Description: Use Azure Monitor to continuously track the performance metrics of Azure Files, such as latency, throughput, and IOPS. Investigate and resolve any anomalies.
Regularly review file share quotas to ensure they are within limits and adjust as necessary to prevent disruptions.
Ensure that Azure Files security settings, such as access control lists (ACLs) and shared access signatures (SAS), are correctly configured and meet organizational security policies.
Implement and regularly verify backup solutions for Azure Files using Azure Backup or other third-party tools. Ensure backups are stored securely and are recoverable.
Review access logs for Azure Files to detect unauthorized access or unusual activity. Investigate and address any security concerns.
Review and update storage policies, including lifecycle management rules, to optimize costs and ensure compliance with data retention requirements.
Conduct regular tests of disaster recovery procedures to ensure file shares can be restored quickly in case of an outage or data loss.
Analyze usage patterns and optimize file share configurations, such as tiering and caching, to improve performance and reduce costs.
Ensure that all operational procedures, configurations, and troubleshooting guides for Azure Files are up-to-date and accessible to the team.
Analyze billing and usage reports for Azure Files to identify cost-saving opportunities and ensure alignment with budgetary constraints.
Regularly rotate SAS tokens to enhance security and prevent unauthorized access to Azure Files.
Provide regular training sessions for the operations team to ensure they are familiar with Azure Files features, best practices, and troubleshooting techniques.
Verify that Azure Files configurations and operations comply with organizational policies and regulatory requirements.
Investigate and resolve any connectivity issues affecting Azure Files, including network latency or access errors.
